p: Campylobacter spp. are spiral, microaerobic, and Gram-negative bacteria that cause gastroenteritis in people and animals, e.g., C. jejuni subsp. jejuni (enteritis and abortion), C. coli, C. mucosalis (porcine enteritis), C. hyointestinalis subsp. hyointestinalis (porcine and bovine enteritis), C. sputorum (abortions in sheep), and C. fetus subsp. fetus (isolated from intestinal tracts of sheep and cattle, sporadic abortions) [ 17, 19, 20].
